channel.title: Need Help With Webserver
channel.description:
I have recently set up apache, php and mysql. Now I tested it on all the computers in the house and it works on them. But when ever anyone else tries to go on it, it well just fails... I have unblocked port 80 in windows and mcafee firewall. I have port forwarded on my router. Yes it still doesn't work.
Do you think maybe my ISP has port 80 blocked?
By the way I have tried closing my windows and mcafee firewall but it still doesn't work.
The url is here: [url=http://enjin.no-ip.org]http://enjin.no-ip.org[/url] it should say "Index of /" at the start.
Thanks for any help in advance.

If you need any help whatsoever, you can MSN me

@system wrote:

it’s no where near finished, I will add features here and there as I go. If you want a beta account just to try find bugs when I have completely finished logging in and logging out just ask me. Or you could just wait until I set up a registration script. Should I use sessions or cookies?

item.title: Need Help With Webserver

item.description:
@system wrote:

thankyou. I configured it on my modems home page. It now works. http://enjin.no-ip.org

Read full topic

item.title: Need Help With Webserver
item.dc:creator: @z z
item.description:
@z wrote:

Then you need to configure your modem if you haven’t already done so. To do that:

  1. Go to Start -> Run…
  2. Type in “cmd”.
  3. You’ll see a Command Prompt window appear, type “tracert google.com”.
  4. There will be a series of IPs that will be listed, we’re only wanting the second one.
  5. The first IP is your router and the second would be your modem. You need to configure your modem through two possible methods:
  • Telnet
  • HTTP
  1. There’s a 50/50 shot that you’ll be lucky enough that you can configure it through HTTP, so take the second IP off the tracerouted (tracert) list and open your default web browser and type in the IP for the address.
  2. If you’re lucky, you should get a response with a page displayed which is run by your modem. With all the variety of modems out there, I wouldn’t have a damn clue how to configure yours, since mine is probably different; just look for Firewall/Port Forwarding and add a new port to be opened.
  3. If there is no webpage, you’ll have to google up how to telnet to your modem.

Read full topic

item.title: Need Help With Webserver
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

I have a static ip address. Im using that. But my internet does work like this: Your computer -> Router -> Modem -> Internet

Read full topic

item.title: Need Help With Webserver
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

You should think about setting the IP for your server PC to a static IP. You should be able to do this from your modem. Then give that IP to no-ip.org. That should allow people to connect to the server.

Read full topic

item.title: Need Help With Webserver
item.dc:creator: @z z
item.description:
@z wrote:

Well, from what it seems, you did everything you were supposed to. The only thing I can think of is that if your internet works like:

Your computer -> Router -> Modem -> Internet

you’d have to configure your modem. Other than that, I wouldn’t have a clue.

EDIT: Maybe give your computer a restart to configure with Services?

Read full topic
